Senior Financial Accountant |12 month Contract

Company Name AIA Australia Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 146 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

WE’RE FOR your growth…

At AIA Australia we focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have all the opportunities to reach your full potential. Join one of Asia Pacific’s largest life insurers that is committed to your personal and professional growth.

We are currently recruiting for a new member of the Financial Accounting team assisting to ensure that team deliverables are met in a timely fashion on an ongoing basis. This role provides pro-active management of areas of responsibility with regard to maintenance and reconciliation of the general ledger, and internal and external financial reporting as well as ongoing process improvement and documentation. This role exists primarily to support monthly management and annual statutory and regulatory reporting by assisting to ensure ongoing integrity of the general ledger.

This exciting postion performs month end close processes in relation to specified areas of responsibility within required timeframes. This includes preparing, reviewing and posting manual journals to accurately record financial transactions and completing timely reconciliations of all assigned general ledger accounts.

Month end requirements will also involve responsibility for completing reporting requirements to support all aspects of group reporting, quarterly regulatory reporting to APRA and annual statutory reporting to ASIC.

WE’RE FOR your wellbeing…

We understand healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing, inclusion and flexibility. With fruit box deliveries, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership (including a FitBit!), we endorse work-life balance.

WE’RE FOR your recognition…

We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.

WE’RE FOR your success…

Your success is ours. Not only do we provide you with all the resources for you to thrive, we enable you to be the best that you can be. We encourage creative thinking and you will even be rewarded for it!

WE’RE FOR you…

For further information please contact nathan.hatte@aia.com

850056362:
[

Research Analyst - Market & Competitive Intelligence

Company Name Deloitte Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 641 views

Job description


About the Opportunity

 Double digit growth for 4 consecutive years, the AFR's 6th most innovative company in Australia - yep, it's been a big year for us. And while sixth is great, let's be honest, there's only one number that really counts.

That's why our Market & Competitive Intelligence team (which is part of the Office of the CSO) is growing, and why we want to up our game when it comes to leveraging market and competitive insights.

Enter you.

 As a methodical yet creative research analyst, you'll undertake competitive intelligence research and present your insights back to senior stakeholders across the firm's leadership team. By providing competitive intelligence analysis and insights to our firm's leaders, your work will help define Deloitte's strategic direction, and you'll get to see your analysis and ideas come to life.

There is a huge scope for growth in this role, making an impact that matters now and even more so in the future!

Pretty cool, right?

In terms of the nitty gritty. This job's 80% research-focused, where you'll be market scanning and sensing (i.e. analysing what currently goes to market, assessing new products and proactively looking for ways to help us differentiate and disrupt ourselves). The other 20% of your time will be dedicated to working with senior partners of the business - whether it be working to a brief or on a proactive discovery task.

You can also expect to:

  • Work closely with the firm's senior leaders on Competitive Intelligence projects involving design, collection, analysis and evaluation of data and information
  • Produce concise CI analysis with actionable insights
  • Have the opportunity to apply your analytical "lens" to the Asia Pacific region and help build out a collaborative, regional team
  • Leverage the firm's competitive intelligence 'engine' to expand and improve deliverables
  • Proactively develop your own ideas around new competitive intelligence products and services


About You
Some people ask 'why', but you'll be the sort of researcher who asks 'why not?' Curious, analytical and creative- you might not have worked in Competitive Intelligence before, but you'll have the skills and background to deliver game-changing analysis and actionable insights.

You'll also have:

  • Relevant experience in or knowledge of consulting, economics, research, business analysis or market analysis
  • Financial modelling and analysis skills; turning numbers into stories and insights!
  • Fantastic Microsoft skills where you can manipulate spreadsheets, drawing key insights and present your findings in a straightforward yet compelling way in PowerPoint
  • Analytical, report writing and presentation skills; data visualisation skills would be a distinct advantage
  • Evidence of creative and structured problem solving skills
  • Very strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to influence and manage senior stakeholders
  • Evidence of strong relationship building skills and a confident presentation style to drive engagement, action and two-way conversations


About us: Deloitte Culture
We pride ourselves on having a team of diverse, high performing professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - they are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one you'll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word.

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent & exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Next steps:
Please send through an application or contact Suzanne Dunne on from the Deloitte Talent Team for further information.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Marketing and Advertising

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Research

850000311:
[

ICT Business Analyst

Company Name Assembly Payments Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 731 views

Job description

The Role


We are looking for an ICT Business Analyst with proven experience working in the fintech and payments industry and an exceptional knowledge of the payments domain. You will have a demonstrable track record with capturing clear, refined and relevant requirements and insight. You will be required to work with our teams in Melbourne, Sydney and Manila as well as Customer stakeholders to perform requirement analysis, feature refinement and story writing. The salary offered for the role is up to $110,000 + Super. In addition your role will cover the following:


  • Understanding and capturing end-to-end workflows (inc third parties) and defining business rules.
  • Work with the Quality Assurance Team and Development Team to ensure that they understand the specifications to deliver a quality product to the business.
  • Work with the Technical Writer to document changes and create release notes. If required work together to develop a training plan for internal stakeholders.
  • Conduct business process modelling and generate applicable scenarios for the technology functionality testing team.
  • Triage defects and bugs related related to current projects and the platform. You will facilitate implementation of new functionality into production and help triage any issues.
  • Promote continuous improvement and innovation in the engineering teams.
  • Working with the Product Manager, publish, review user stories, requirement documents and release notes.
  • Working with the Engineering Manager to assist in interviewing and recruiting new people to the team.
  • Helps with user testing to confirm issues/bugs/results of specific features with development team to expedite fixes/releases.
  • Coordinates UAT activities with internal and external users (as required).
  • Work with stakeholders to ensure internal team process documentation is updated as part of a release.
  • Work with the Product, Engineering and Business stakeholders to manage and maintain the delivery roadmaps.


The Individual


This is a great opportunity for an experienced BA looking to grow and advance their career further. \xa0To be successful you will:


  • A bachelors degree or 5 years of Business Analyst Experience is a must
  • Have substantial experience as a Business Analyst in a software environment, with a proven track record of capturing clear, refined and relevant requirements and insights
  • Have experience with products such as Atlassian Jira and Confluence
  • Have experience working with remote/distributed teams
  • Be well-spoken and able to effectively communicate with internal and customer stakeholders of varying degrees of technical expertise and seniority
  • Thrive within a high pressure but open environment which promotes a level of autonomy and a strong sense of ownership and responsibility
  • Have a positive attitude and willingness to learn and adapt as the company continues to grow
  • Proficiency in industry-standard process methodologies (e.g., Six Sigma, LEAN, ISO, CMM, etc.)
  • Ability to travel interstate and internationally at short notice
  • Genuine collaborator
  • Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, customer service, negotiation, conflict management and time management skills\xa0

Recruitment Coordinator

  • 1 month contract - Immediate start

The Organisation


This dynamic and successful organisation specialises in providing insurance, superannuation, and professional services to specialised industry sectors. They have a reputation for developing and supporting their people in an innovative and technology-driven culture.




The Opportunity


This is an exciting opportunity for a recruitment coordinator who is available to start immediately to provide recruitment support and utilise their recruitment skills and knowledge of the recruitment process for one month.


You will develop an in depth understanding of business requirements and in partnership with hiring managers and HRBPs select the best talent into the organisation.

852603614:
[

Airfares Distribution Coordinator

Company Name Helloworld Travel Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 116 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A vacancy exists for a full time Airfares Distribution Coordinator to join the SmartFares department within our Air Tickets division in Melbourne. \xa0



The Role \xa0 \xa0

As an Airfares Distribution Coordinator will have the primary responsibility to ensure that any fares received from the Airlines in Australia and New Zealand are delivered promptly to the market which involves broadcasting them onto the internal processing queue and onto our SmartFares website. You will continue to assist with any fare-related queries that are received internally (within AirTickets or Helloworld) and externally (from Airlines or our clients) which are mainly handled via email and over the phone



You will be responsible for:

  • Accurate and correct loading of fares onto the internal processing queue for loading into either the SmartFares website or the GDS
  • Update and maintain fare pages when required
  • Redistribution of fares through the GDS through Travelport - Agency Private Fares (APF), Sabre – Fare Retailer and Amadeus - FaresXpert.
  • Manage & maintain fare distribution groups for both SmartFares Website and GDS.
  • Action any fare-related queries via email or phone
  • Investigate any errors affecting SmartFares and/or the GDS
  • Investigate issues that agents may have with SmartFares website
  • Update Internal Staff of any Airline Advices to so that they can effectively assist with our agents
  • A pleasant and professional manner when taking incoming telephone queries from our customers.
  • Providing superior airfare assistance to our customers, this involves being practical, flexible, accurate and offering options.

\xa0

\xa0

Skills and Experience Required

  • Knowledge of New Zealand Fares/Ticketing would be looked upon favourably, but not essential
  • High level of customer service
  • Good understanding of Travel Agency operations, both leisure and corporate
  • High competency level of fares and ticketing, with ability to decipher fare sheets and rules quickly and accurately
  • Knowledge and experience of 2 or more CRS systems
  • Self-motivated and proactive in expanding own knowledge and skill set
  • Excellent keyboard skills with a high degree of speed and accuracy
  • Ability to communicate with your co-workers, in a professional and understanding manner.
  • Accepting that all people have different levels of expertise and using your knowledge to enhance the skills and or knowledge of others.
  • Must be punctual, professional and conscientious at all times.
  • Ability to solve problems professionally and efficiently whilst adhering to company policies

\xa0

\xa0

About Air Tickets

For over 60 years Air Tickets has been making life easier for Travel Agents and airlines by providing a 'one-stop shop' for international fares distribution and ticketing services. Today, Air Tickets is selling airfares on behalf of over 100 international airlines to over 2,500 travel agencies nationally. At Air Tickets our goal is based on a simple service concept - delivering air tickets quickly, correctly and at the right price.

\xa0

As a member of the Helloworld Travel Group - working at Air Tickets will provide you the opportunity to be part of Australia's leading integrated travel businesses. The group encompasses travel brands providing franchised retail services, wholesale products, specialist government and corporate business travel and ticket distribution services across eight countries.

\xa0

To apply for this fantastic opportunity, please email your resume and covering letter by close of business Friday, 14 September 2018.


To be eligible to apply for this position, applicants must have existing Australian work rights.\xa0 Only short listed candidates will be contacted for an interview and may be required to complete an Australian Federal Police background check.


Recruitment Agencies - thank you for thinking of us, however we do endeavour to fill our opportunities through direct channels wherever possible.

IT Customer Experience Manager

Company Name Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) Company Location Level 22 530 Collins St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 304 views

Job description

About the Role:


Due to internal growth opportunities within AEMO, we are excited to announce we have a new position within the Enterprise Infrastructure and Technology Operations Leadership team, within our Technology Department.


As the IT Customer Experience Manager, you will be accountable for all elements of our internal and external customer’s experiences within Technology and its supporting services. This includes leading the external contact centre, as well as the internal digital workplace support services which makes up a team of just over 20 employees dispersed around our six locations nationally.

\xa0

We are looking for someone that can take this team to the next level! Bring your energy, innovation and experience to really build up the teams capabilities and how they interact with both our internal and external customers.

\xa0

Key accountabilities:

\xa0

  • Represent AEMO in a range of public and industry engagement
  • Lead and influence the organisation wide reinvention of the workplace, influencing workspaces including the physical and online collaboration spaces
  • Provide expert advice on project or stakeholder issues within AEMO, and to AEMO’s diverse range of stakeholders, including generators, distributors, regulators, and jurisdictions
  • Manage special requests and escalations as they occur
  • Drive team performance targets that include utilisation, ticket management, and customer service feedback
  • Partner across the organisation to provide thought leadership and policy development through sharing knowledge of latest digital trends, current innovations, and road maps
  • Lead change and implement new ways to meet business objectives, improve team capacity to deliver to its stakeholders, devising and sponsoring OPEX/CAPEX initiatives as required

\xa0

Required skills and experience:\xa0

\xa0

  • Tertiary qualifications in IT, Business Administration, computer science, information management or related field, or equivalent work experience
  • Certification in ITIL Foundation
  • 10 or more years of work experience, preferably in business or IT management, or ideally combination of the two
  • 5 or more years’ experience in delivering IT and Customer Service Support using a service management system (e.g. ServiceNow, Remedy, Oracle, HP Service Centre)
  • Experience managing internal /external customer-facing support services, help desks, and a wide variety of organisational relationships
  • Experience of motivating a large, geographically distributed team
  • Great communication skills and a can-do attitude
  • A strong problem-solving capability
  • Highly developed interpersonal and organisational skills
  • The desire to have an impact on AEMOs working culture
  • Demonstrably customer-centric in their approach
